With no drinking water, UP family seeks.description: AGRA: Upping the ante against unavailability of drinking water in a Hathras village, a family has written a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking permission to end their lives, as the government had failed to provide them basic facilities for their survival. The missive has been filed by Chandrapal Singh, an MBA graduate, who had earlier decided to auction himself along with several youths in the village on Republic Day to raise money for supply of household water connections. The protest, however, did not take place as, it was cancelled by local administration. Besides the letter, Chandrapal, a resident of Nagla Maya in Hasayan block, has released a video in which he and his minor daughters appealed the PM Modi to listen to their complaint, else give them permission to end their lives as they can not drink excessive “salty” water. Singh said that it is unfortunate that even after 72 years of independence, they have to travel several kilometres for getting drinking water. In a video clip, Singh said, “It is better to die once than to live everyday in pain. We have been suffering from this problem for the past two years and no one has resolved this issue”. He added that he has to walk at least 2-3km everyday to bring drinking water for the house in the weather when temperature is touching 45 degree Celsius. “No one can understand our plight. Government officials cannot even take a sip of water, which we drink to survive. Our children too consume the same water,” he said. Claiming that over 3 lakh people in 150 villages in Hathras are affected by the problem, he said that they have written about about their plight to everybody, from the the district magistrate to the President of India, but the issue has not been resolved yet. When contacted senior divisional magistrate Sikandrarao, Ramji Misra, said that issue will be resolved soon. He said, “Many projects could not be taken up due to model code of conduct in the recent elections”. He assured to take up this matter on priority. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Conman who used to pose as govt official.description: Agra: A 39-year-old impostor who claimed to be a bureaucrat from West Bengal was arrested from The Oberoi Amarvilas in Agra on Friday. Identified as Soumyajeet Sanyal, a resident of Salt Lake, Kolkata, the conman, who stayed in luxury hotels and resorts and fled without clearing his bills, was booked under IPC sections 419 (punishment for cheating by personation) and 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) by Tajganj police.Tajganj station house officer Sanjay Kumar Pandey said, “Sanyal would throw names of officials and political leaders to get free stay and food in high-end hotels. On Thursday, he stayed in Yamuna Railway Rest House and had lunch at The Oberoi Amarvilas by introducing himself as a member of the national tourism advisory council. On Friday, he again returned to The Oberoi Amarvilas but this time, he was confronted by staff to pay his bill. When he refused, cops were called by hotel staff and his bluff was called out.”On his Facebook and Linkedin profiles, Sanyal claims to be an alumnus of Institute of Chartered Financial Analysts of India, Hyderabad, from where he pursued MBA and studied tourism management from West Bengal University of Technology. He also claimed to be head of public relations, consultant and advisor to various government departments, like tourism, HRD, petroleum, transport, civil aviation, information-culture-broadcasting and others.On his social media accounts, he also shares selfies with Bollywood actors, like Farhan Akhtar, singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya, yoga guru Ramdev and several politicians.Senior superintendent of police Jogendra Kumar said, “There is very high probability that conman Soumyajeet Sanyal would have duped many hotels and other institutes across the country. We are going to question him in detail to understand the web of his conmanship and the reasons behind it.” According to the FIR lodged by sub-inspector Ashok Kumar, Soumyajeet Sanyal had even stolen a mobile phone of an employee of a private guest house based near Agra Cantt station where he stayed briefly. (With inputs from Ajay Tomar)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Stray dogs menace hits Taj Mahal.description: AGRA: Even as the Archeological Survey of India (ASI) continues to grapple with the simian menace at the Taj Mahal, the world heritage site is now under ‘attack’ of stray dogs, compounding problems for both the tourists and the staff. A video of stray dogs roaming inside the Taj lawns went viral on social media on Tuesday, attracting criticism from the netizens. This comes at a time when on an average 150 cases of dog bites are reported every day in Agra, according to data shared by the health department. However, ASI superintending Archeologist in Agra circle, Vasant Swarankar, claimed that the dogs that were spotted on the Taj premises were removed immediately. He said the stray dogs enter the premises only during rain, when the staff and other people are indoors. Tourism Guild Association secretary, Rajiv Saxena, however, termed it “utter negligence’ on the part of the officials. “I am deeply hurt, as the symbol and icon of the Indian tourism is being allowed to be thronged by dogs.” A hotelier in Taj Ganj, Sandip Arora, said such kind of pictures and videos raise questions over security at Taj Mahal. “It is also the matter of tourists’ safety, who spend huge amount of money to see the world heritage monument,” he said. He added that the tourists were earlier bitten by simians inside the monument, and now stray dogs are creating a scare for the travellers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

3,300 out of school children identified.description: AGRA: Following orders of the state government, the basic education department had identified over 3,300 children who were out of schools. In first three months of the new session which started in April, all the identified students have been enrolled in the state government-run primary schools. They will be attending regular classes from July after end of the summer vacation. However, the data compiled by the basic education department indicate that the state government’s special program named ‘Sharda – School Har Din Ayein’ for enrollment of out of school children ended in a formality in rural areas. According to the official data, in city areas and 15 blocks of Agra district teachers identified 3,332 children between age group of 6 to 14 who were not going to school. Out of these 1,063 were enrolled in city areas, whereas in entire Fatehpur Sikri block only seven children were found not going to school. Ahead of the new session, state government had directed that teachers should step out of schools to identify children not going to school. Teachers were required to spread awareness about benefits of education especially among weaker sections of the society, and ensure no child is left to get benefit of free education. In city areas, teachers took out rallies to promote the Sharda program. Non-government organisations also made efforts for enrollment of the out of school children. Apart from city area, 413 out of school children were enrolled in Jagner block, 370 in Kheragarh, 264 in Baroli Ahir, 210 in Pinahat, 201 in Khandoli, 161 in Bichpuri, 12 in Fatehabad, 114 in Jaitpur Kalan, 94 in Shamshabad, 85 in Fatehabad, 50 in Bah, 46 in Achhnera, 43 in Saiyan, 39 in Akola and seven in Fatehpur Sikri. District in-charge of the Sarv Shiksha Abhiyan said, “The admission process will continue till September end. After reopening of schools in July, second round of campaign to identify out of school children will be launched. This time the focus will be on rural areas. Teachers will reach every doorstep to take children to school. Officials will also make efforts to ensure every child goes to school.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shortage of doctors hits emergency and O.description: AGRA: Acute shortage of doctors and specialists has hit the OPD and emergency services at the government district hospital in Aligarh. While 30 EMOs are required for a hospital with around 300 beds as per NITI Aayog guidelines, Malkhan Singh district hospital, which has 232 beds, is being managed by only one EMO and a few specialists. Patients and their attendants continue to have a tough time as only one Emergency Medical Officer (EMO) is working. There are no cardiologists, physicians, dermatologists and dental surgeons in the hospital. Chief medical superintendent (CMS) of Malkhan Singh district hospital, R Krishan told TOI that they are working on a theory of maximum work in minimum facilities. He admitted that patients are facing problems. With the specialist doctors put on emergency duties, they have to wait for 2-3 hours in OPD. The CMS said that at present, the hospital has two paediatricians on record but only one is working along with three general surgeons, one ophthalmic surgeon and one ENT surgeon. “We have written to the higher authorities to fill the vacancies and are hoping to get more doctors soon,” said Krishan. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP Metro corporation seeks map of water-.description: AGRA: Following the state government orders to expedite Agra metro rail project works, the Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRC) has asked the district administration and the Agra Development Authority (ADA) to provide a map of water, sewer, and gas pipeline network of the city within 15 days. The officials said the map would help in implementing the required arrangements for hassel-free construction of two-corridor metro rail project in the city. The UPMRC will first start the work on corridor 1 from Sikandra to Taj East Gate. This corridor is proposed to have its depot at the PAC ground near Taj Mahal. An official of the UPMRC said, “Responsibility for arrangement of required land for development of the metro rail infrastructure is of the ADA. Work has been initiated in this regard. Before starting the construction work, a city-wide survey will be conducted. In this regard, the district administration, municipal corporation, jal nigam, private power distribution company and other agencies have been asked to provide maps of their underground infrastructure in the city. This will help in sorting out hindrances in implementation of the metro rail project”. On February 28, the Union had Cabinet approved the Agra Metro Rail Project which is estimated to cost Rs 8,379.62 crore and is planned to be completed in five years. A total of 27 stations will be developed along 29.4 km of the rail corridor in the city. According to the detailed project report (DRP) approved by the Union Cabinet, the Agra Metro Rail Project will have two corridors which will pass through the heart of the city and will connect prominent tourist places, including the Taj Mahal, Agra Fort and Sikandara as well as ISBT, Raja Ki Mandi railway station, medical college, Agra Cantt railway station, Collectorate, Sanjay Place and other densely populated areas. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Missing girl\u2019s decomposed body foun.description: AGRA: The decomposed body of a 19-year-old-girl was found murdered on the outskirts of Mainpuri’s Kukamai village in a maize field on Friday, four days after she went missing. According to police, body of Rubi Singh, who was pursuing BA second year, was spotted in the field, 500 meters away from her house, by a local resident. Post mortem report ruled out sexual assault as her clothes were intact. The police said prima facie, the girl had been strangled with her dupatta that was found tied around her neck. According to local residents, the girl was in relationship with a boy identified as Surjeet. However, her family members did not approve of her friendship with him. Angry with her family, she left home on June 10. Her body was recovered from the field on Friday. Senior superintendent of police, Mainpuri, Ajay Shankar Rai, said the murder case had been registered against two youths Surjeet Kumar and Abhishek Kumar, who hail from Kukamai and Nagaria village respectively, on the complaint lodged by the girl’s father. Abhishek Kumar has been arrested by the police while five persons from the youth’s families have been detained for inquiry. Family of the girl did not file a missing complaint at the police station. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Found unfit during drill, two cops given.description: AGRA: Two cops, including a sub-inspector and head constable, were given voluntary retirement on Friday morning after they were found unfit during morning parade at Kasganj police line which was conducted in presence of superintendent of police Ashok Kumar Shukla. Identified as SI Rajpal Singh, 58, and head constable Indrapal Singh, 59, the duo was asked for voluntary retirement after they were unable to even stand during the parade, said police sources. Speaking to TOI, Ajay Bhadauria, public relation officer of Kasganj police said, “The cops were complaining of having physical constraint and pain below the torso. After a mutual agreement, the duo decided to take VRS and left the police force.” Bhadauria added that two more cops were punished and their one day salary was deducted after they failed to report for morning parade. Identified as constables Narender Kumar and Prashant Kumar, the duo was also summoned by SP, Kasganj.” Meanwhile, three other cops were warned after they were found wearing inappropriate uniform for the parade. Aligarh girl\u2019s murder: FSL report i.description: AGRA: The Uttar Pradesh government’s Agra-based Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) report has failed to confirm or deny sexual assault on the two-and-a-half-year-old girl, whose brutal murder in Aligarh’s Tappal area earlier this month had triggered nationwide outrage. The state police have now sought the court’s permission for taking a second opinion on the vaginal swab tests from the FSL in Lucknow as well as the Central Forensic Science Laboratory in Chandigarh. Senior superintendent of police Akash Kulhary said that the court has granted the permission for further examination of the autopsy report which had earlier ruled out possibility of rape. He said the videography clipping of the post-mortem will also be sent to Chandigarh and Lucknow. The doctors, who conducted the autopsy, had said that putrefaction (decomposition) had set in and her skin had begun to peel off. That may have been the reason why it was initially thought that her eyes were gouged out. The report also indicates that the “amputation” of the child’s right arm was caused by insects that had nibbled away at her limb. Besides other injuries, she had also suffered a leg fracture 5 cm below the left knee and her ribs were sticking out from her chest. The girl was found in a garbage pile on June 2, three days after her abduction, her limbs bitten away by insects, maggots crawling all over her tiny body. Police have arrested four persons, including prime accused Zahid Ali, his wife, Shabusta, brother Mehndi Hassan and his associate Aslam, in connection with the brutal killing of the girl child over a financial dispute with the victim’s grandfather. Aligarh: BJP leader murdered by his brot.description: AGRA: Aligarh’s BJP youth wing vice president, Saurabh Sharma, was allegedly beaten to death at his house on Sunday night by his elder brother over a property dispute. According to police, the incident occurred around 10 pm when Saurabh’s elder brother Abhishek came back home in Jaiganj locality, where the joint family resides. Both brothers had an argument over some property and things turned ugly. Abhishek allegedly picked up a pedestal fan that was lying near by and hit it on Saurabh’s head and fled the spot. Family members immediately rushed Saurabh to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries. Saurabh was also the member of district working committee and brother-in-law of former BSP MLA Mukul Upadhyaya. Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Akash Kulhary said that a case has been registered against five persons including Abhishek Sharma and his relatives under sections 302 (murder), 34 (When a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all), 147 (rioting), and 148 (armed with deadly weapons) of IPC on the basis of a complaint filed by the deceased’s wife Lily Sharma. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Two Delhi men killed in road accident on.description: AGRA: Two men from Delhi, working in a private firm in Agra, were killed in a road accident on Yamuna expressway. The victims, identified as Ajit (25) and Pawan (24) of Mayur Nagar, Phase III of New Delhi were found dead in a pool of blood, near milestone 77 of Naujheel police jurisdiction of Mathura district on Friday night around 8:30 pm, by a patrolling team of private concessionaire, operating on the Yamuna expressway. The team informed the local police and the bodies were sent for autopsy. Speaking to TOI, SP Sharma, station house officer of Naujheel, said, “The two victims were on a motorbike and could’ve possibly been hit by a speeding hatchback registered in Mathura RTO. The car had big dent on its bonnet and was left by its driver after the accident. We have seized the car and are searching for the unidentified accused involved in the accident.” “The motor-bike was thrown off the expressway stretch and the two bodies were found several meters away, near the expressway fencing. It seems that the victims were on the left side of the stretch and the speeding car rammed them from behind. The driver of the car could have fallen asleep or been intoxicated,” Sharma added. The relatives of the two victims were informed about the incident. By the time this report was filed, an FIR in the matter was yet to be registered.” Meanwhile, in another road accident on Saturday afternoon at around 3:30 pm, three occupants of a hired taxi were found injured on Yamuna expressway in Mathura district. The victims were taken to the hospital and were said to be in stable condition. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Agra: Man stages abduction to skip court.description: AGRA: A man was arrested by Malpura police of Agra district for allegedly staging his own abduction in order to avoid appearing in the court in a loan repayment case. Resident of Sarai Pukhta under Fatehpur Sikri police jurisdiction, the accused, identified as Shavazz Ahmad, was arrested from Medakur area on Wednesday morning. Ahmad owns a small garment store at Kheria Mod under Shahganj police jurisdiction. According to police, on June 12, Riyaz Ahmad, father of the accused, had lodged an FIR at Malpura police station under IPC section 364 A (Kidnapping For Ransom) against Shavazz’s previous employers. Giving details about the case, station house officer (SHO) of Malpura, Vijay Kumar Singh, said, “During the probe, we came to know that Shavazz Ahmad used to work at the garment store owned by Rajendra Goel and Shivkumar Goel in Bansal market. After sometime, he borrowed a hefty amount from his employers and opened his own store at Kheria Mod. However, Shavazz failed to repay the amount to the trader duo who then sought help from the court and filed a case against Shavazz for cheating, fraud and criminal intimidation. He said, “With the help of his 13-year-old nephew, Shavazz spread a fake message of abduction and held Rajendra Goel and Shivkumar Goel responsible for the crime. When we asked the teenaged boy to narrate the sequence of his uncle’s abduction, he broke down and let the cat out of the bag. Shavazz went off to Chennai via Delhi to his friend’s house. Later, he returned to Agra and was caught on an anonymous tip off.” Accused Shavazz was booked under IPC sections 120B (Punishment of Criminal Conspiracy), 193 (Punishment For False Evidence), 195 (Giving Or Fabricating False Evidence With Intent To Procure Conviction Of Offence Punishable With Imprisonment For Life Or Imprisonment) and 211 (False Charge Of Offence Made With Intent To Injure). On Wednesday, he was sent to jail. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

With no drinking water, UP family seeks.description: AGRA: Upping the ante against unavailability of drinking water in Hathras village, a family has written a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking permission to “end their lives, as the government had failed to provide them basic facilities for their survival”. The missive has been sent by Chandrapal Singh, an MBA graduate, who had earlier decided to auction himself along with several youths in the village on Republic Day to raise money for supply of household water connections. The protest, however, did not take place as it was cancelled by the local administration. Besides the letter, Chandrapal, a resident of Nagla Maya in Hasayan block, has released a video in which he and his minor daughters appealed to PM Modi to address their complaint, or else at least give them permission to end their lives as they cannot drink excessive “salty” water anymore. Chandrapal also said that it is unfortunate that even after 72 years of independence, they have to travel several kilometres for getting drinking water. In a video clip, Chandrapal said, “It is better to die than to live every day in pain. We have been suffering from this problem for the past two years and no one has resolved this issue.” He added that he has to walk at least 2-3 km every day to get drinking water for the house in the 45-degree Celsius heat. “No one can understand our plight. Government officials cannot even take a sip of water which we drink to survive. Our children, too, consume the same water,” he said. Claiming that over three lakh people in 150 villages in Hathras are affected by the problem, he said that they have written about their plight to everybody, from the district magistrate to the President of India, but the issue has not been resolved yet. When contacted, senior divisional magistrate Sikandra Rao, Ramji Misra, said that the issue will be resolved soon, and assured to take up this matter on priority. “Many projects could not be taken up due to model code of conduct in the recent elections,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Eight members of a family killed after c.description: AGRA: Eight members of a family were killed on Sunday after the car they were travelling in bumped into a truck from behind on Yamuna Expressway in UP's Mathura district. The victims hailed from Jewar of Gautambudh Nagar district and Khurja (Pahasu) of Bulandshahr, and were heading to Agra to visit Taj Mahal, when their hatchback allegedly rammed into rear end of a truck registered with Karnataka RTO. According to police, the accident occurred at around 8.40am near milestone 140 under Baldeo police jurisdiction of Mathura district. The deceased were identified as Neeraj (25) wife of Prem Chand, Anita (30) wife of Shiv Kumar, Anjali (13) daughter of Shiv Kumar, Vishnu (25) son of Suresh, Karuna (22) daughter of Sulekh, Shalu (19) daughter of Jai Prakash, Santoshi (20) and Gabbar Singh (25) son of Brahm Singh. Speaking to TOI, Major (retried) Manish Singh, in-charge, coordinator, Yamuna Expressway said, “The hatchback was probably cruising at a very high speed, there was nothing intact in the mangled car. Expressway rescue team which reached the location in nearly six minutes, found six bodies along with two grievously injured trapped inside the car. We immediately rushed the victims to nearest hospital.” Sunil Kumar Singh, station house officer of Baldeo said, “The car had rammed into rear of a truck, which suggest either the car’s driver felt asleep on steering wheel, or the truck driver applied sudden brakes in middle of the road. After the accident, the truck driver along with his vehicle fled away. The registration number of the truck was found from the accident spot, which was registered with Karnataka RTO.” “The bodies have been sent for autopsy and an FIR has been launched,” he added. Talking to TOI, Prem Chand, husband of deceased Neeraj, said, “Around 16 members of our distant family were heading to Agra to visit Taj Mahal in two cars via Yamuna expressway. We all had left for Agra from Khurja on Saturday night and had brief stay at my in-law’s home in Naujheel of Mathura district. On Sunday morning, we resumed our journey. I was driving my van and ferrying all male members of the family including my two children. When the accident happened we were nearly 10-12km away from hatchback and had no idea about the tragedy.” “All eight members of my family including my wife, niece and friend were killed,” said Prem Chand who runs a small store of electrical items in Jewar. In another road accident on Yamuna expressway on Sunday early morning at around 12.53am, a sedan rammed into an iron railing and turn-turtle. The accident occurred at 156 milestone of Khandauli police jurisdiction of Agra district. According to police, the four victims in the car hailed from Delhi and were heading Bihar to attend a wedding ceremony. One of the victims identified as Pawan Bhambhani (35) succumbed to his injuries during treatment in hospital. While his three friends, Lalit Thapa, Arun Bhewal and Manto were injured. According to rescue team of the expressway, the turtled sedan was later hit by another overspeeding car. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Illegal eateries a motorists\u2019 night.description: AGRA: Commissioned in August 2012, the 165.5-km-long Yamuna Expressway was introduced for smooth and quick connectivity between Agra and the NCR region. However, with regular accidents and other nightmarish conditions, the state-of-the-art Expressway - which runs parallel to National Highway-2 - has now turned into an ‘ordinary highway’. Unauthorised eateries, bus stands, road interchanges, not only interrupt high-speed traffic, but also increase road accidents. According to available data, 905 people lost their lives and 9,336 were injured in 5,751 road accidents on Yamuna Expressway. Sources of private concessionaire responsible for operating Yamuna Expressway said that over 150 written complaints and reminders were sent to local police stations in Mathura and Gautam Budh Nagar districts about mushrooming of roadside eateries along the Expressway. These eateries often damage and remove barbed wires and fences to gain access to commuters, particularly truck drivers, motorbike riders and even bus passengers. “The situation has become so grim that both state-run government buses and private buses make regular pit stops at these eateries. It seems the drivers have some sort of monetary commission arrangements with these eateries. Sadly, these eateries pose a great threat and many have lost lives after being hit by speeding vehicles near these places,” said Major (retired) Manish Singh, in-charge coordinator of Yamuna Expressway. “Parking vehicles on the Expressway is prohibited unless there is a genuine case of breakdown.” “Apart from eateries, several unauthorised bus stands have cropped up along the Expressway. This also contributes to rise in accidents,” said the Expressway official. Another source claimed that owing to local political pressure to appease residents of rural areas, two interchanges were opened near Baijana (Mathura) and Jewar (Gautam Budh Nagar), where commuters now openly flout traffic norms and travel in wrong directions to save fuel and time. The source also added that trucks carrying cattle to slaughterhouses between Agra and Aligarh stretch pose high risk to commuters, as the drivers tend to overspeed in order to avoid right-wing groups and police teams who either extort money or assault them. The drivers of cattle trucks mainly operate during night hours and “hardly care if they hit anyone on the road in order to save their own lives”. Attempts were made by TOI to contact SSP Mathura and DIG Agra range, but the officers were unavailable for comments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman\u2019s body found near Yamuna expr.description: AGRA: Almost two weeks after the body of a two-and-a-half-year-old girl, who was brutally murdered, was found in Aligarh’s Tappal area, another mutilated body of a middle-aged woman was found in a deserted plot in Simrautti village near Yamuna Expressway on Sunday. According to Tappal police, the woman’s body was wrapped in a black polythene and it was spotted by some local residents. Police said, prima facie, the body had been dumped at the spot after killing the woman. Local Forensic Science Lab (FSL) team was called for taking samples as the woman’s body found lying on some liquid. Police said the deceased woman was about 40-year-old. She appeared to be married as she had worn bangles on her wrists. Talking to TOI, Tappal circle officer, Sanjeev Dixit, said that the body will be sent for post mortem and further investigations are on to identify the deceased and her killers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Eight of a family among nine killed in r.description: AGRA: Eight members of a family were among nine killed in two separate road accidents on Yamuna Expressway in Mathura and Agra districts. The eight victims were on their way to Agra to visit Taj Mahal, when their hatchback allegedly rammed into the rear of a truck, registered with Karnataka’s regional transport office (RTO). The victims belonged to Jewar of Gautam Buddh Nagar district and Khurja and Pahasu of Bulandshahr. In another road accident on Yamuna Expressway on Saturday at 12:53 am, a sedan rammed into iron railing and turned turtle. The accident occurred at milestone 156 of Khandauli police jurisdiction of Agra district. According to police, the accident - where eight members of a family were killed - occurred at 8:40 am near milestone 140 under Baldeo police jurisdiction of Mathura district. The victims were identified as Neeraj (25), wife of Prem Chand; Anita (30), wife of Shiv Kumar; Anjali (13), daughter of Shiv Kumar; Vishnu (25), son of Suresh; Karuna (22), daughter of Sulekh; Shalu (19), daughter of Jai Prakash; Santoshi (20) and Gabbar Singh (25), sons of Brahm Singh. Major (retired) Manoj Manish Singh, manager of Yamuna Expressway, Mathura section, told TOI, “The hatchback was probably cruising at a very high speed." He added, "There was nothing left of the mangled car. Expressway rescue team which reached the location in six minutes, found six bodies along with two grievously injured trapped inside the car. We immediately rushed the victims to the nearest hospital.” They died during treatment. Station house officer of Baldeo, Sunil Kumar Singh, said, “The car had rammed into the rear of a truck, which suggest either the car’s driver fell asleep on steering wheel, or the truck driver applied sudden brakes in the middle of the road. After the accident, the truck driver fled in his vehicle. The truck’s number plate was found at the accident site, which was registered with Karnataka RTO.” “Bodies of all the eight victims have been sent for autopsy and a written complaint has been taken from their relative to lodge an FIR,” he added. Prem Chand, husband of deceased Neeraj, said, “Around 16 members of our distant family were travelling to Agra to visit Taj Mahal in two cars via Yamuna Expressway. We all had left for Agra from Khurja on Saturday night and had a brief stay at my in-law’s home in Naujheel of Mathura district. We resumed our journey on Sunday morning. I was driving my van and ferrying all male members of the family, including my two children. When the accident took place, we were 10-12 km away from the hatchback and had no idea about the tragedy.” “All eight members of my family, including my wife, niece and friend, were killed,” said Prem Chand, who runs a small store of electrical items in Jewar. In the other road accident, the car’s four occupants hailed from Delhi and were on their way to Bihar to attend a wedding, the police said. One of the victims, identified as Pawan Bhambhani (35), succumbed while being treated at a hospital. His three friends - Lalit Thapa, Arun Bhewal and Manto - suffered injuries. According to expressway rescue team, the sedan was also struck by another speeding car. A source from Yamuna expressway claimed that occupants of the sedan were in an inebriated state and were speeding when the accident took place. Rohit Bhambhani, deceased victim's brother said, "Pawan was not inebriated when accident occurred. The autopsy report has confirmed it." A total of 4,956 accidents, 718 deaths and 7,671 serious injuries were recorded on the Yamuna Expressway between August 2012 and March 31, 2018, an RTI reply had revealed. In this period, a total of 2.33 crore vehicles violated speed limits, data provided by automatic surveillance gadgets and number plate readers installed at various points showed. However, only 17,883 were issued challans by traffic police in four UP districts of Agra, Aligarh, Mathura and Gautam Budh Nagar. Data available from the Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) revealed that 23.42% accidents were caused due to speeding while 12% were due to tyre bursts.
